content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ephesians 5:22-33, vs. “Nevertheless let each one of you in particular so love his own wife as himself, and let the wife see that she respects her husband”

While a way from home, we sometimes bring air mattress for us to sleep on. When ready to sleep, we blow it up until its firm then go to sleep. I have realized many times that by mid morning or sometime when I wake up, the mattress is no longer firm, creating discomfort. Forget about sleeping on it is gone, very frustrating. The next day we look for holes to seal only to repeat the same cycle as we discover there are more holes in this thing leaking out air that should keep it firm.

This is no different from marriages that start airtight, very firm only to find down the road that it is not firm, as it should be or how it was from the beginning. There are things leaking out leaving this thing called marriage wobbling in every direction. For the last few days, God has given me a burden to pray for marriages, as there are many under silent frustrations. The smile is there on the outside but on the inside, there are fed up individuals, under pressure, very insecure, and resenting folks. The Love that was to keep it airtight is silently leaking out because there are things that are poking holes in it.

We see people who have been successful building corporations; great CEO’s, manages successfully corporations with thousands of employees but failed in one thing, marriage that involves two people. How will we stand when what we hoped and dreamed of is not what it became when we got there? In addition, where do we go from here? My prayer as we do a series on marriages is that God will fireproof our marriages. That does not mean fire will not come, it just means when it comes it will find us prepared.

First things first, I believe God created marriage primarily to conform us to the image of Christ. This is to show us that it’s more than happiness. I know we are programmed to ask ourselves what is this in for me, what will I gain out of it, how will it benefit me but that’s the wrong order of things. That it becomes easy to give when you have received and no one finds it easy to be the first one to give when they feel the other person does not deserve it. Then all that happens is we go through unending cycle of silent frustrations that lead to nowhere and some end up leading to divorce.

I hope that for the next few days we can share with you some encouragements concerning your marriage as we also pray for you. Moreover, those who are under silent frustrations will take time to heal and be restored to the glory of God. Marriages are tough, we can’t make them work on our own. Like Mary and Joseph who received instructions from heaven as to how to raise baby Jesus, we too need instructions from heaven on how to grow and maintain what God has joined. My dad always says, “Marriages are made in heaven, they are perfected here on earth. We have to be in God’s will, ready for change and ready to grow. I know not of any other place that I can grow more than in my God given marriage. Blessings Ev

BTW, on Friday I became an uncle to baby Devyn Matthew Awando. Baby came in about 6 weeks early but he is doing well, my brother brother in law Peter and my sister Linda are doing well. Praise God

title.rendered: Conversations On the Run, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Then they said to him, ” Tell us, now! On whose account {has} this calamity {struck} us? What is your occupation? And where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?” 9 He said to them, “I am a Hebrew, and I fear the LORD God of heaven who made the sea and the dry land.” 10 Then the men became extremely frightened and they said to him, “How could you do this?” For the men knew that he was fleeing from the presence of the LORD, because he had told them.  11 So they said to him, “What should we do to you that the sea may become calm for us?”–for the sea was becoming increasingly stormy. 12 He said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea. Then the sea will become calm for you, for I know that on account of me this great storm {has come} upon you.

Have you ever been on your way someplace and someone was trying to speak with you and time was of the essence at that moment?  If so then you were having a conversation on the run.  However what happens when you have a conversation and you are on the run from God?  The story of the running prophet is none other then Jonah, called be God to go to Nineveh, but running to Tarshish which was in the opposite direction.  Jonah had a conversation with pagans as to the nature of the storm which the pagans felt were going to take their lives.  While he was on the run from God from which we can learn what to do if we ever find ourselves having conversations of the run from the Lord.

    1. Disobedience is seen by others.  During the times that we are in disobedience to God, we are trying to hide from God, but others see the symptoms of our disease of sin.  When everyone was trying to deal with the problem of the storm Jonah was sleeping instead of trying to help.  Did he really think he could hide from his Creator who knows and sees all?

2.      Disobedience becomes your witness?  Jonah was staying below the ship instead of shinning above it.  God has called us to shine His light to the world.  During disobedience that light does not shine to the brightness that it was meant to.  Like Jonah we too are called, yes you, everyone of you, to preach repentance to the unsaved.  However the motivation to preach repentance will not be present in your life if you are not repenting yourself, and need to, and if you are not engaging in reaching the lost as Jonah had for a time.  The only two answers to disobedience are ultimately death or repentance. Choose!

3.      Disobedience is questioned by others.  The pagan sailors asked Jonah a flurry of questions: Tell us, now! On whose account {has} this calamity {struck} us? What is your occupation? And where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?  It was Jonah’s disobedience that promoted these questions.  Now these pagans were religious people as each called upon their own god, but eventually, I believe that, Jonah was seen as a hypocrite.   “Hypocrites may show up at a church building every Sunday, but there are no hypocrites in the Church (Christ’s body). Hypocrite comes from the Greek word for “actor,” or pretender. Hypocrisy is “the practice of professing beliefs, feelings, or virtues that one does not hold.” The Church is made up of true believers; hypocrites are “pretenders” who sit among God’s people.

4.      Disobedience affects others.  Jonah’s disobedience affected those on the ship.  Although it may not kill others, your disobedience to God hurts other people, many of those people are ones that you love, perhaps family members, friends.  The unsaved (as in Jonah’s case) are also hurt because you are not walking in your role as a witness, therefore they remain lost.  Disobedience seen by others, becomes your witness, is questioned by others, and affects others.  Repent today, or tell someone else their need to repent, because disobedience is not worth it.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

Good morning,

Proverbs 24:16,”for though a righteous man falls seven times, he rises again,..” (NIV)

One of the most frustrating things is dealing with failures. There is no joy in knowing you have fallen or failed. Competitions have winners and losers, that is how it is set up but how about when there is no competition? We cheer up for winners and we rejoice when we are winners but what do we do when we fall and or fail? You may be frustrated with yourself right now over failing to meet a dead line, or failing an exam, or failing to win what you hoped to have won. What about failing to please the Lord with your life, fell in sin or sinned so bad that you wondered whether there was any more mercy left for you. You have fallen many times and each time you asked for forgiveness and mercy and they were granted each time. This time you feel you have fallen too hard and too far that you do not believe no mercy is left on your God given personal account to be released to you. I have encountered some people who were so mad at themselves over how they failed that they would not forgive themselves over the past failures. It is not like God had not forgiven them, God had done it but they found it so hard to forgive themselves over what they did. God forgot about it, but they keep reminding God of what they did. That is what is pulling them down and hindering their progression with God. Failing is part of life, we don’t want to fail yes but at times it comes and we can either use it to advance ourselves by learning from it or use it to put ourselves down.

Proverbs 24:16,”for though a righteous man falls seven times, “. “Though” indicates that there is possibility, an indication that a righteous man may and will fall and not ones but several times. We can trace it’s origin from Adam and all who came after him failed the test even before taking it. Falling is not an option however, it does happen as you grow and as you walk to your destination, making choices that will lead you there. There are some things you have no control over that will either make you win or loose. The key thing is to realize that there are possibilities and what you do when you fall or fail matters a lot Jesus understood that though His disciples were strong while He was with them, there was going to come a time when they would be faced with challenges and even fail. He tells Peter in Luke 22:31 And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon! Indeed, Satan has asked for you, that he may sift you as wheat. 32, But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail; and when you have returned to Me, strengthen your brethren.” Peter was not planning on failing but the devil was determined make him fail and Jesus knew about it yet He does not even stop the situation. All He does is let Peter know what awaits him and what He has done for him in the situation. Jesus says to him, “But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail“. In other words, everything can and may fail but when you have faith in God, that faith will cause you to pick yourself up again and keep moving. You have enough faith in God to work with when the flesh fails, when all you hoped and dreamed for fails. A righteous man falls seven times and he rises again because He has enough faith to work with. When one falls or fails, what happens?, They still have enough pieces of things they need to assemble them back together again. Jesus tells him, “when you have returned to me“, this was an indication that his failure would move him further from the Lord but his faith in Christ will somehow bring him back to find the Lord and encounter with him again. God would use his experience to strength his other brothers who would face situations like that too.

Have you fallen or failed?, the bible says the “righteous” man not the “wicked” falls seven times but he keeps on rising because he has faith to pick him/herself up again. You can’t keep crying over spilled milk, don’t you understand you have enough to work with to get you back on your feet again?. You have faith to believe God can forgive you and faith to believe God can help you rise again and give you new avenues for progression. 1 John 2, “1 My little children, these things I write to you, so that you may not sin. And if anyone sins, we have an Advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. 2 And He Himself is the propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only but also for the whole world”. You faill when you don’t rise, therefore RISE UP, you have enough to work with. Blessings Ev, God’s servant

title.rendered: The Sound Of Abundance Of Rain, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 18, “41 Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.” 42 So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees, 43 and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.” So he went up and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”

It is hard to understand God’s ways but He sure can be trusted. I do not think Elijah expected the blessing of the rain to delay, after all, he called on God and fire from heaven immediately came. Waiting for the rain appeared to be taking time. He could not doubt God’s word to make it happen. He had enough trust in God to take God at His word. Numbers 23:19, ““God is not a man, that He should lie, Nor a son of man, that He should repent. Has He said, and will He not do? Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good? Romans 3:4, “…let God be true but every man a liar”. When you know God’s ways rather than His works, you can choose to trust when it does not make sense, when it is not clear or even when it has delayed. God can be trusted.

Like Elijah, I hear the sound of abundance of rain in this year the reason I am on my knees praying. I have no idea what kind of rain God will send my way or when but I will continue to trust Him even when I do not understand. We see Elijah sending his servant to check on the promised rain 6 times. Who knows if his servant wondered, “what’s the use of checking on something that is not there”. On the seventh time, he gets a report of “A cloud as small as a man’s hands in the rising from the sea”. Imagine for a second the man of God expecting abundance of rain to fall on the land, after several checking it yields a small cloud like man’s hands. He was not discouraged; he knew God had answered his prayers. It was small yet significant. The little is the confirmation he needed.

Great blessings often arise from small beginnings, and showers of plenty from a cloud of a span long. Let us therefore never despise the days of small things, but hope and wait for great things from it. Small beginnings are like seeds; they do not look much but have potential of producing much. It is with the little that we see and thank God for that we trust as it unfolds while we grow in it and through it.

I am learning more and more that it is not when you have it all together that you move or when you see the big picture that you act. It is in the process of taking those small steps day by day that the Lord unfolds what He is doing and wants to do in your life. Ecclesiastes 11:4, “He who observes the wind will not sow, And he who regards the clouds will not reap”. You make those small steps by faith having fireproofed your faith through prayer and the word

While some are promising that it is going to be a great year (as they always do every year), I would say it could be a great year if we heed to God’s call. Let us go back to basics, prayer and the word; may God repair those who need repairing; may we remember God wills then waits. Elijah told Ahab to run home for it was going to rain and it did. Summary on the series,  2 Chronicles 7:14, “if My people who are called by My name will humble themselves, and pray and seek My face, and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin and heal their land”. God can be trusted, He never fails. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Sound Of Abundance Of Rain, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 18, “41 Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.” 42 So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees, 43 and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.” So he went up and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”


In reforming the Israelites by first rebuilding the broken altar, Elijah challenged the prophets of Baal and Asherah to prove to the entire crowd the true God. Fire falls on Elijah’s sacrifice upon seeking God. Note the order, before God showered them with blessings, Elijah offered an excellent sacrifice that pleased the Lord. We seek to please God first (Psalm 103:1, Matthew 6:33) while we trust God to shower us with blessings too. Let us give Him what He requires of us.
Abel and Cain offered sacrifices to God. God had respect for Abel’s sacrifice rejecting Cain’s sacrifice. God did not leave them to figure out what He desired of them, He told them what was pleasing to Him. Here is how we know Genesis 4:6 Then the LORD said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why is your face downcast? 7 If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? (NIV), Abel offered his sacrifice by faith so did Elijah and God had respect for both sacrifices. We need to learn more and more what the Lord requires and offer it by faith. How to please the Lord is revealed and instructed in Word, it’s then fueled and powered by faith in God. Romans 10:17, “So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God”
We see that upon demonstrating to all the true God, Elijah ordered the false prophets be destroyed at his command. This prepared the way for what the Lord was about to do. Back in the day, false prophets were killed if their prophesies did not happen. As Matthew Henry says, “Israel being thus far reformed acknowledged the Lord to be God, and had consented to the execution of Baal’s prophets, that they might not seduce them any more, though this was far short of a thorough reformation, yet it was so far accepted that God thereupon opened the windows of heaven, and poured out blessings.”

Elijah sent Ahab to eat and drink, for joy that God had now accepted his works, and that rain was coming. It was time to rejoice for the Lord was about to release His blessings. And Elijah, by faith, hears the sound of abundance of rain. He retires himself to pray while waiting for the rain by faith. He cast himself down on his knees upon the earth, in token of humility, reverence, and importunity, and put his face between his knees. He ordered his servant to bring him notice as soon as he discerned a cloud arising. Six times his servant goes to check and sees nothing, brings no good news to his master; yet Elijah continues praying. Though the answer of our fervent and believing supplications may not come quickly, yet we must continue instant in prayer and not faint nor desist; for at the end it shall speak and not lie.

God will’s then waits for His people to respond in prayers. God had promised Elijah drought would end but Elijah had a job to do, pray the blessing through. Those who desire the abundance of rain will have faith, seek God fervently in prayer, patiently wait until He has moved. Those who do this would have no room for discouragement, for they will understand they are in God’s will, 1Thessalonians 5:16 Rejoice always, 17 pray without ceasing, 18 in everything give thanks; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you. To finish, Blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Sound Of Abundance Of Rain, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 18, “41 Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.” 42 So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees, 43 and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.” So he went up and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”

In talking about drought for many in 2009, who would not want the rain of God’s blessings in 2010? Ahab and the people expected that Elijah would, in this solemn assembly, bless the land, and pray for rain; but he had something else to do first. The people must be brought to repent and reform, and then they may look for the removal of the judgment, but not until then.
I am always amazed at how many times we are asked to claim and receive blessings but rarely do we hear about restoring and reforming things lost and bent out of share or building what it will take to maintain blessings. No one can pour precious stuff in a leaking vessel, it will leak out. You have to restore the vessel, repair it first. We need our character and integrity built to sustain and retain the blessings brought about by God. How often do you pray to God to build your character, integrity, give wisdom, teach you patience, desiring preparation to be a good  steward? It is easy to ask for blessings with nothing to sustain them. Listen to what Elijah did in preparation to what God was going to do, 1King 18:30, “Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.”… And he repaired the altar of the LORD that was broken down”, what had been broken down and forgotten about called for repair. Instead of Elijah doing something new, he repaired the old that the Israelites had left to seek other things. You may have left the ways by which to be blessed and sought other ways, may be running from one conference to another; trying to work your way through things by yourself; waiting for someone to have a word from the Lord for you. We have to go back to the foundation, prayer and the Word which will repair you.

While others are looking for the new sensation, new fad, new experiences, new feelings, extra biblical manifestations, I believe God is bringing His people back to the basics; where they lost their direction. Repairing the altar of the Lord broken down by other things. Paul encourages believers in Romans 12:1 by saying, “I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service”. The repaired altar is for a sacrifice that is pleasing to the Lord. You may have been damaged by sin, damaged by drought; fear, doubt, depression etc instead of seeking God for something new, why not seek the Lord to repair you again for His service. No one is beyond repair.

My prayer, “God do not send your rain of blessings until you’ve repaired me first”, I do not want blessings poured in a leaking vessel, it will not retain it. I desire of the Lord that my life will be presented to Him as a living sacrifice for His service. A life consecrated for His work. More displaying His glory. Giving Him what is right and not what is left. I would desire for you and myself this year more of spiritual blessings, it begins with repair. What are you trusting God for this year? Are you being repaired in readiness for what He will do? It’s time to show up in the Lord’s workshop, Jeremiah 18. to continue. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Sound Of Abundance Of Rain, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 18, “41 Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.” 42 So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees, 43 and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.” So he went up and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”

One of the disappointing things while I was in school was writing and essay only to be told that I missed the whole point. All the work done, hours spent only to miss the whole point of what I was to write on. If you were to be asked to write a report or an essay about this year we are concluding today, would you miss the whole point about your life and why this year had to be what it has been? When I missed the point on my essays, the only way to escape it was to re do it and get it right. I can see the same with now, if you missed the whole point of 2009 in your life with everything that had happened, you may have to repeat the class in 2010.

Elijah appears in 1Kings and proclaims a drought for three years. This began a series of miracles to demonstrate to the people who the true God was. There was Yahweh the almighty God and so was Baal, additional false god they were worshipping. Israelites had mixed worship of both, moving away from serving the only God to serving other gods along side the almighty God. They did not deny God; they just didn’t serve Him whole-heartedly. In that drought period, Elijah challenged the prophet’s of Baal in the presence of all the Israelites 1Kings 18:21, “And Elijah came to all the people, and said, “How long will you falter between two opinions? If the LORD is God, follow Him; but if Baal, follow him”.

This has been a year of drought too and I believe it came about to remind people who God is and turn to Him. I believe most people still missed the whole point and you would tell by what they say. I don’t recall many people drawing to God or even calling on God. This drought has also been a reminder that things that people hold onto firmly like finances can tank in hours, days, weeks or even months. Things that people have labored for years. It has been a reminder that though it has been a drought that has affected us mostly physically; it was also to be an avenue by which God would use to bring about a spiritual hunger for Him.

If you were to write an essay about this year for yourself, what would you say? I would say it’s been a very enriching year for me spiritually in regards to praying effectively, being in the word, teaching, seeing lost souls come to the Lord, seeing my youngest brother getting awakened spiritually and for the first time drawn to the things of God, seeing my wife grow more and more spiritually. Yes, it has been a very difficult year for us financially but I have not missed the dynamics brought about by the drought. It has been a pruning process and the pruning can be hard and painful but the results are amazing.

It is in the drought that God demonstrated to the Israelites that He was the true only God to be worshipped and trusted. It is in the drought that God demonstrated to the people that one man of faith, standing firm righteously could make a change when their trust is the Lord. It is in the drought that God demonstrated that He could sustain; he sustained both Elijah and Zeraphath as recorded. It is in the drought that they saw God. Today finish 2009 strong as your reflect on how God has worked on your life in this drought, project 2010 by faith. To continue. Happy Blessed New Year. Blessings Ev and Judy, Phil and Stephanie

content.rendered:
Good morning,

The Refining Silversmith ‘And He shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver” (Malachi 3:3).

And he shall sit: God is never in a hurry.  He sits while many times we run around.  He sits, while we worry.  He sits showing us that we have stability in Him.  He sits so we know that His lap is always available for us to sit upon in our time of need.  This is for when things are going well or poorly in our lives.

As a Refiners Fire and a purifier of silver: What comes to mind?  I think of working on the details, the kinks, getting the “bugs” out.  An Asian proverb in the book The Five Rings says 1,000 years of training, 10,000 years of refining.  What is the difference between the great sports players and the average ones, refinement?  A good golf player is not able to bounce a golf ball on his club continuously by chance.  He develops his coordination after thousands upon ten thousands of times training.  Look at the instructions for the Tabernacle; do you think God was concerned just a bit about details?  And why does God want to refine us, to make us the most precious silver we can be.  Pure silver is an expensive metal.  That is why Jesus says, “what does it profit a man to gain the whole world and loose his soul“.  We are more precious to God than the whole world.  How does God refine us, take a look at this illustration.

Some time ago, a few ladies met to study the scriptures. While reading the third chapter of Malachi, they came upon a remarkable expression in the third verse: One lady decided to visit a silversmith, and report to the others on what he said about the subject. She went accordingly, and without telling him the reason for her visit, begged the silversmith to tell her about the process of refining silver. After he had fully described it to her, she asked, “Sir, do you sit while the work of refining is going on?” “Oh, yes ma’am,” replied the silversmith; “I must sit and watch the furnace constantly, for, if the time necessary for refining is exceeded in the slightest degree, the silver will be injured.”

The lady at once saw the beauty and comfort of the expression, “He shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver.” God sees it necessary to put His children into the furnace; but His eye is steadily intent on the work of purifying, and His wisdom and love are both engaged in the best manner for us. Our trials do not come at random, and He will not let us be tested beyond what we can endure.

Before she left, the lady asked one final question, “How do you know when the process is complete?” “That’s quite simple,” replied the silversmith. “When I can see my own image in the silver, the refining process is finished.”      -Author Unknown-

Final thoughts James 1:2-4 “Consider it pure joy, my brothers, whenever you face trials of many kinds, 3 because you know that the testing of your faith develops perseverance.  Perseverance must finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything”.

How do you perceive trials, as stumbling stones or stepping stones?  What trials are you in now that God is using to refine you, but perhaps you’ve been complaining? Blessings, Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Peter 3:15, says “15 But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, AND ALWAYS BE READY to give a defense to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and fear;”

About two weekends ago, two JW’s (Jehovah witnesses) visited our home. We gave them an opportunity to share what they believe and why they believe what they believe. Sharing from their very selected verses to support their belief. After they were done, having known some of their positions especially on who Jesus is, we took time to ask them tough questions in their world view and in that process also shared the gospel with them. We now pray that the Holy Spirit will awaken them, convict them and lead them to the true light.

I often ask people these two questions, “what do you believe” and “why do you believe what you believe”. People often trip on these two questions, going round and round not making it clear (I was like that too a few years back). 1Peter 3:15, says “15 But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, AND ALWAYS BE READY to give a defense to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and fear;”

The use of “defense” in 1 Peter 3:15 is general: Whether formally in an official setting or informally to anyone who might inquire, a believer is to be ready to provide an answer. That answer is about “the hope that is in you,” which is the Christian faith. Believers should be able to give a rational explanation of their salvation and Christian faith. If you can’t stand for something, it will be easy to fall for anything. We got to be the ones to influence because we have the truth or else we will be influenced which will draw us away from the truth.

Mark 13:22 and Matthew 24:24, 22, “ For false christs and false prophets will rise and show signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect. 23 But take heed; see, I have told you all things beforehand”. What is interesting is that, we will run into people who are in cults who will seem to speak the same language as we do, use the same words and even feel like they are one of us. It’s in the probing that you find that you mean different things. For example we could all say we know John but the moment we begin to describe the John we are talking about, we discover they are not the same. That is why you as a believer ought to be ready with God’s word to know what you believe, why you believe what you believe and defend what you believe. Mark and Matthew tells us that “false christs … will rise”, we don’t have to wait for them to arise, they are already here proclaimed by others, it’s the christ not revealed in the Holy Scriptures. Paul fireproofed his son in the faith Timothy by admonishing him with this words, 2 Timothy 2:15, “Be diligent to present yourself approved to God, a worker who does not need to be ashamed, RIGHTLY DIVIDING THE WORD OF TRUTH”. Timothy was going to be faced by people who preached another gospel that appeared real. Paul even mentioned two of those people in this chapter. He told Timothy “rightly divide the word of truth” which is an indication of some who will come and wrongly bisect God’s word making it appear real. Timothy was to be ready at all times to defend the faith.

1Corinthians 3:11, “For no other foundation can anyone lay than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ”. We must truly know this foundation and build our lives on it. We must also know those who pervert this foundation and not embrace all who name the name of Christ who may be talking of false christs. 2Timothy 2:19, “…the solid foundation of God stands”, this is the true foundation that cannot be shaken, the foundation to bring other’s too.

If someone was to come to you and ask you about what you believe and why you believe what you believe, are you ready to fulfill 1Peter 3:15? Let us be ready, let God’s word fireproof us for the coming days so as not be part of the deceived. In addition, let’s not shy from those of other faith, they need to hear the truth. God’s truth will set them free from all lies of the enemy John 8:32. blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Corinthians 4:2, “Moreover it is required in stewards that one be found faithful”

Quick story, a man borrowed a cooking pan from his neighbor. A couple of days later he brought it back to the owner. To his neighbor’s surprise, not only was his pan brought back in good condition and clean, inside of it was another small pan. His neighbor reminded the man who had borrowed the pan that he had only given him one not two. The man explained the reason for the small pan. While it was at his house, the pan gave birth to a small one and therefore it belonged to his neighbor. A few weeks later, this man went and borrowed the same pan, his neighbor was glad to give it to him, after all, miracles seems to happen at his house, pans give birth. Upon waiting for his pan to be brought back for days, he went to inquire about his borrowed his pan that had not been returned. The man quickly jumped up to explain that the borrowed pan had died and he buried it. His neighbor standing there stunned said to him, “I don’t understand how a pan can die” and the borrower said, “If you believed it gave birth in the first place, why can’t you believe it  died”. Whatever has a beginning has an end.

Often we find it easy to take good care of things that belong to us and not the things that belong to others. If you know that the company can to afford it, why take good care of it? If you live in a rented home or apartment, why take good care of it if you are paying rent to live there? If you rent a car, why keep it clean if it’s not yours? If you are checked in a hotel, why shouldn’t you throw things around the hotel room after all someone is paid to take care of it. Saw something out of place, why fix even if I am in a position to, simply because it’s not my responsibility? We are all called to be good stewards and what is a steward, one who manages another’s property, finances, or other affairs. Every good thing that God brings your way that may not be what He has placed in your hand as your own He requires you to be a good steward of it. He wants you to treat it as your own and I would say even better than your own. Christians ought to be different when it comes to handling other people’s stuff. How about what God has placed in your hands? You ought to be a good steward as to what you put in your body and on your body; after all it doesn’t belong to you but God. A good steward when it comes to your finances, living within your means and taking good care of what God blesses you with. I have seen people abuse blessings God brought their way.

The above scripture reminds us of our requirement of stewardship, “be found faithful” in other words to be loyal, trusted, reliable, steadfast, devoted until the time of the Father. How faithful you are determines what can be entrusted in your hands. It’s not about who owns it, it’s a matter of taking good care of it. It’s a matter of being faithful even when you don’t feel like it. Joseph was a good steward in Potiphar’s house. Listen to Paul speaking 1 Corinthians 9:16, “For if I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast of, for necessity is laid upon me; yes, woe is me if I do not preach the gospel! 17 For if I do this willingly, I have a reward; but if against my will, I have been entrusted with a stewardship. 18 What is my reward then? That when I preach the gospel, I may present the gospel of Christ without charge, that I may not abuse my authority in the gospel. Are you a good steward? the story above showed a good steward for a season, be a good steward always. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Do you hear what I hear?, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about: His mother Mary was pledged to be married to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be with child through the Holy Spirit. 19 Because Joseph her husband was a righteous man and did not want to expose her to public disgrace, he had in mind to divorce her quietly.  But after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit (Mt 1:18-20)”.

In this day and age there are a lot of voices speaking, but none as important as the voice of the Lord.  The Scriptures speaks of Joseph (Mary’s husband to be) as a righteous man not wanting to make a public display of his love (Mary).  His was willing to protect and provide for her needs at this confusing time.  At first Joseph didn’t understand it all, but his actions were dictated by his integrity and his love for his fiancé.  Although Joseph did these noble things he still lacked in one area, he had not heard from the Lord yet.  The angel Gabriel had spoken to Mary at this point, but not to Joseph (Lk. 1:26-38).  Mary is spoken of often in the Christmas story, but Joseph seems to be given a lesser role, a backseat role in the birth of Christ.

Yet God is looking for men of God to hear from the Lord.  In Mt. 2:13, Joseph hears from God to take his family into Egypt because Herod would try and kill Christ.  Thank God Joseph wasn’t too busy to hear and obey God or we would all have been in trouble because our Savior would have died before His time.  Of course God would not have let that happen, but yet God worked through fallible humans to accomplish His will.  Again in Mt. 2:19-21, we find God speaking to Joseph about leading his family back to Israel, because God knows where He wants you.  Sadly though many men believe God and church are for women only, and that they are to work and bring home the bacon.  Yet from Scripture, before Joseph and Mary were married God spoke to both of them, and after they were married God spoke to Joseph, not Mary, concerning the leadership of their family. God desperately desires men that He can speak to, to lead their families in the way the Author of the family designed.

God said, “I looked for a man among them who would build up the wall and stand before me in the gap on behalf of the land so I would not have to destroy it, but I found none (Eze. 22:30).” Where are the Christian men building up, and standing in the gap for their families?  Statistically if 100 children profess Christ, 3.5 families will be added to your church; if 100 women profess Christ, 17 families will be added, but if 100 men come to the Lord, 93 families will be added!  God saves both men and women, desiring they both to hear and obey Him.  But God is calling for men to spiritually lead their families, but without waiting on Him how can a man obey this?

Application:  Men are you more emotionally focused on your job, or your family?  Yes you are to be the breadwinner, provider, but remember jobs come and go, you are replaceable at work, but your family only has one husband, one dad.  If you die your job will  fill your role, but your family won’t.  Listen to the voice of God, so you can spiritually lead your family, because this God will hold you accountable for.  Women, give your spouse room to lead, pray diligently for him, because as a man and husband I know WE NEED your prayers.  Women make sure that you too are hearing from the Lord.  And may you together bring your children up in the fear and admonition of the Lord.  Here is practical help for family devotional time.  Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 144:3, “LORD, what is man, that You take knowledge of him? Or the son of man, that You are mindful of him?”

We are very interesting beings when you think about it. We have issues, we go through changes, we loose sense of directions many times, we deal with fear, we complain and many more stuff. I often wonder why the Almighty Perfect God would keep up with us. Remember God promised to deliver the Israelites from Egypt and bring them to the promised land. As they were being led to the promised land, they complained and mumbled but God was very patient with them. I don’t know about you but I find it hard to keep up with people who cannot get their acts together. After sometime either you get it together or get lost because I could dedicate that precious time for something else. I’m glad the Lord does not deal with us the same way.

I tend to ask myself this question, Psalm 144:3, “LORD, what is man, that You take knowledge of him? Or the son of man, that You are mindful of him?” It’s already been established that there is no one good but God. God does not reach out to us on that basis and the very best we can bring before the Lord has flaws Isaiah 64:6, “But we are all like an unclean thing, And all our righteousness are like filthy rags; We all fade as a leaf, And our iniquities, like the wind, Have taken us away“. Remember it does not say “our SINS are as filthy rags”, it says “our righteousness are like filthy rags”. When God blesses you and not someone else, it’s not because you are a little better or deserve it, it’s because of His grace and mercy. Man has issues but He still lifts him up. He may even curse God but He still shows him mercy. It blows my mind more so when the Lord blesses me and I don’t deserve it at all. At times right in my mess ups, He still steps out to deposit a blessing into my account. It’s like Lord, don’t You have something better to do than deal with such a broken vessel? I’m amazed that His blessings are not based on who I am and what I can do but on who He is and what he can do. That His blessings are not about me but about Him. That He has chosen to pick me up when no one is around to pick me up. You will agree with me that if you are going through something, people can stand with you up to a certain point and if they see no change, they will call it quits. As for Him, He is a friend who sticks closer than a brother. All may be tired and leave but He sticks closer. Lord, what is man, that You take knowledge of Him?

I’m attached to a blessed Vine, what a blessing. Thank God for the Roman soldier who pierced Him on the side. He opened away for me to be grafted in to partake of His blessings through His covenant. I’m blessed in the field; on the mountain; in my going out and in my coming in. I’m blessed at home and I’m blessed at my job. I’m not blessed when I receive the blessing, I’m blessed even on the verge of waiting for it for faithful is He that has promised. I have no reason to have this amount of blessing in my account all I know is that He decided to bless me. Proverbs 10:22, “The blessing of the LORD makes one rich, And He adds no sorrow with it”. No one who is blessed has sorrows because blessings are signs of abundance. This goes for spiritual and material blessings. I have joy blessings deposited in my account. I can encourage myself and others in the Lord because He has deposited encouragement blessings in my account. I count my blessings one by one. God was mindful of us, He gave us His Son, the greatest gift to satisfy the demands of the law we couldn’t pay, 2 Corinthians 5:21, “For He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might become the righteousness of God in Him”. If no one takes knowledge of you in this Christmas time, remember the Lord does. Lord, why do you take knowledge of me? Blessings Ev

title.rendered: I Will Be With You Says The Lord

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Joshua 1:9, “Have I not commanded you? Be strong and of good courage; do not be afraid, nor be dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.”

In this life we live in, we need company. We can’t make it alone, we know that. Just because we don’t want to be alone does not mean we just need people to help us in one way or another, we may just need company. If you look at a child who is terrified, a parent’s presence is enough to calm him or her down. He or she may not look to the parent to take the fear away; the presence of a parent is enough to overcome their fear. They believe the parents are bigger than their imaginary monsters that appear real.

What about us believers, at times we are not looking for answers, we are looking for someone to be there with us. Their presence is enough to make us face what we could be running away from. In Joshua’s case, he always had Moses with him. That made him feel strong and courageous fighting in battles. When Moses was gone, the Lord encouraged him of His presence; He may have seen that He needed His presence now more than ever. And the Lord said to him, “Be strong and courageous. Do not be terrified; do not be discouraged”, God wasn’t giving Joshua anything, He was assuring him of His presence and the peace he needed would come about because of God’s promised presence. Just like a child who gains peace and confidence, not because of what the parent (s) give him at the time of weakness and fear but what comes about because of their presence. Three times in Joshua 1, God assures Joshua of His presence, Joshua 1:5,”… as I was with Moses, so I will be with you, 1:9, “for the LORD your God is with you”, 1:17, “…only the Lord your God be with you”. God’s presence alone was enough to take away fear and give him courage to go forward. God was with Joseph in the absence of his father Jacob. Jacob did not even know what became of his son but God was with him in the pit, in portiphar’s house, in jail and even on the throne. God was with Daniel in the lion’s den; he was with Shadrach, Meshack and Abednego in the fire; he was with David when he was running away from Saul; he was with Jonah when he tried to flee from His presence; He said to Abraham, in Genesis 26:3, “dwell in this land, and I will be with you and bless you. He told Jacob in Genesis 31:3, Return to the land of your fathers and to your family, and I will be with you.” He told Gideon in Judges 6:16, Surely I will be with you, and you shall defeat the Midianites as one man”. What did all these people have in common, they were all afraid and their situations did not change but God’s presence was with them through it all.

He is Emmanuel God with us in this Christmas season. He is Jehovah Shammah, the ever present God. He is present with our kids even when they are not with us. He is present in our spouses even in our absence. He is present in us in our jobs when we get overwhelmed. What a joy to know that He is ever present. He does not need to come, He is already here and how He would speak to us like He spoke to Joshua, “Have I not commanded you? Be strong and of good courage; do not be afraid, nor be dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.” We don’t need Him to come and solve, His presence is enough to solve so remember, don’t be discouraged or afraid, He is with you. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 19: 23 Then Jesus said to His disciples, “Assuredly, I say to you that it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven. 24 And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.” 25 When His disciples heard it, they were greatly astonished, saying, “Who then can be saved?” 26 But Jesus looked at them and said to them, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

In business there are things looked into for the health and the growth of the business. They look at the ASSETS and the LIABILITIES columns as part of their analysis for the business. Assets are properties or things or people of great value, in accounting, they are items on balance sheet that constitute the total value of an organization. Liability has a different description, for the sake of the point I would like to make, I will describe it as something that holds somebody back (organization, business) or causes trouble.

Here is a classic example of a RICH young ruler coming to Jesus with what he considered assets to gain him everlasting life. He comes ready that upon being told what it took to have eternal life, he could pull it out of his bag of good things. Vs. 21 Jesus said to him, “If you want to be PERFECT, go, sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”. He admitted to have kept some of the commandments and Jesus seeing that he was determined to have all these in his assets column, he tells him that if he wants his asset column to be perfect, he has to get rid of all that he had. In actuality, Jesus was showing him where his heart was, it was in his money and you cannot serve God and money.

Then Jesus says how hard it is for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God. Of course, we know of rich men who are saved and are being saved. I believe the deeper understanding of this would be someone having what he calls good (declaring himself rich) because he believes he has what it takes to gain eternal life. This is someone who has taken his attempts to be good enough before God and placed it in his asset column. Such would be hard to save; they are trusting in their own merit to gain eternal life. Paul tells us in Romans 7:9, “I was alive once without the law, but when the commandment came, sin revived and I died. 10 And the commandment, which was to bring life, I found to bring death. 11 For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it killed me. … 13 Has then what is good become death to me? Certainly not! But sin, that it might appear sin, was producing death in me through what is good, … Everything that Paul once considered an asset, something to save him actually brought death, in other words became a liability to him. What was to give him value, trying to keep the law, made it more impossible to gain eternal life. When he thought he was rich with good works it only turned out to condemn him. That’s what condemns people today who consider themselves rich with good works and would not declare themselves bankrupt and trust on Christ riches of righteousness to save them.

Proverbs 11:4, “Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness delivers from death”, Men’s assets won’t save them in that day only Christ’s rich mercy provides the righteousness he needs to stand before God. Under conviction, Paul filed chapter 11,  Philippians 3:7, “But what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ. 8 Yet indeed I also count all things loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ 9 and be found in Him, not having my own righteousness, which is from the law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith.

Are you trusting in your riches to have eternal life, trusting in your good works? If you are, Jesus has a message for you, Matthew 19: 24 And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.” When you realize that everything you counted on to save you is a liability, tainted with sin, be done with yourself, file chapter 11, declare bankrupt, put all your today’s assets in the liability column and receive Christ who is rich in mercy to grant you the righteousness you need today and everyday. He’s righteousness is the asset you need in your column. When the disciples wondered who could be saved then, Jesus said “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”. Your salvation and mine are impossible without Him. Repent of your sins today, and trust and embrace Christ who died on the cross and rose again to save you and He will. Read the word and obey what it says and God will never fail you. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: He Is Not Done With You, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 19:1-3, “.. And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, also how he had executed all the prophets with the sword. 2 Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I do not make your life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time.” 3 And when he saw that, he arose and ran for his life…”

If you are ever going to do anything for the Lord, be sure that the spirit of Jezebel will show up when you have done what you need to do. The spirit of Jezebel always brings fear, threats and is out to steal your faith and confidence in God. If Elijah called on God to answer by fire and He did, couldn’t he have believed God for fire to defend him from Jezebel? The bible says that God went before the children of Israel by day as a cloud of wind and by night as a pillar of fire. Darkness is associated with evil therefore Elijah being threatened was the presence of evil and he needed God to go before him by night as a pillar of fire. Some of us need God to go before us today as a pillar of fire as we face our Jezebel.

After running for his life into the wilderness, praying that his life would be taken away, then fed by God, It’s an encouragement to us that God cares for his servants in the moments of triumphant and in the moments of defeat. The Lord does not abandon us when we are defeated and we shouldn’t abandon the Lord when we feel defeated. A true believer will run to the Lord when his life is under pressure and they feel like giving up, they will also know that their confidence is not in themselves but God. When Elijah ran into  the wilderness looking for death only to find life, , God reached out to him. This is the Lord I fall in love with daily. Like Ravi Zacharias always says that, “God did not hide the scars of our hero’s in the bible”. That even the men of God used mightily had their moments of struggle with sin, fear, battles, challenges you name it and we can identify with them.

Vs 8, “So he arose, and ate and drank; and he went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights as far as Horeb, the mountain of God”, Given food and drink which kept him running 40 days and 40 nights, wow!!. We get hungry after every few hours. God knows what we NEED best and He supply’s it. “My God shall supply all your needs according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus”, Philippians 4:19, “My grace is sufficient for you, My strength is made perfect in weakness” 2Corinthians 12:9. God gave Elijah what he needed for that period of time and it was enough to sustain him in the journey God had set for him. I believe the Lord was teaching him that what He had started, He would be faithful to complete it and because He wasn’t done with Elijah, He would provide all the necessary tools he needed to keep him strong. You will realize that after being fed, never again did he complain that he wanted to die. Remember this, when it gets tough, He is offering to ease your burdens, Matthew 11:28, “Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest“. It’s not giving up that you need, it’s the rest you need for the journey is still long. If He was done with you, He would have killed you Himself but the fact that you are alive and kicking is an indication that your journey is not over. You may be missing in action yet you are being prepared for a come back. God will give you rest, equip you, feed you, reveal Himself to you and will send you back to where you tried to run away from. The only difference is that you are going back as a changed, renewed person. Blessings Evans, God’s servant

title.rendered: He Is Not Done With You, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 19:1-3, “.. And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, also how he had executed all the prophets with the sword. 2 Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I do not make your life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time.” 3 And when he saw that, he arose and ran for his life…”

Elijah’s encountering with the prophets of Baal is a very interesting story in the fact that he was so zealous for the Lord. He challenged the prophets of Baal as one man to prove to them all who the real God was. In other words, 1 man against 450 prophets of Baal. They were all prophets only that one was a true prophet of God and someone had to challenge the theology of the rest. What an awesome opportunity to stand for the Lord. You might be the only believer yet you are not intimidated by the fact that the people surrounding you are not believers, you can stand strong and tall and challenge their stand through your lifestyle, your walk, your message. Elijah did, prevailed and killed all the 450 prophets of Baal. Upon receiving a word of what happened to her prophets, Jezebel threatened to kill Elijah and he ran for his life. How is it that we can have boldness to fight but at times some type of Jezebel threatens us and we run for our lives? Fear is lethal, it cripples. King Ahab was not a threat to Elijah but his wife Jezebel the queen was. That boldness he once had to stand for the Lord is threatened and challenged.  Listen to his cry to the Lord 1Kings 19:4, “…And he prayed that he might die, and said, “It is enough! Now, LORD, take my life, for I am no better than my fathers!” It’s over, I’m done, I’m finished, I can’t see anything beyond this, I don’t see any more victories lined up for me, take my life. I can’t fight any more, it’s just too much. I caved when the pressure was too much. I conquered many prophets of Baal by God’s grace but that Jezebel threatened to take my means of livelihood and I couldn’t help but find a place to hide. Elijah did not see the reason for living anymore and he was right because after all, he would die by Jezebel’s sword but if the Lord did it, he would die peacefully. Couldn’t this man who called fire from heaven stand on the thought of whose he was?

Like I said, God knows what we need better than we do, God knew this man was under pressure. Dying was not what he needed; he needed encouragement, refreshment, rest, food and a time to refocus. The Lord responded to his need first before he dealt with his complaint. Vs. 5″…suddenly an angel touched him, and said to him, “Arise and eat.” He needed to be away from everything else to be one on one with God. He had a want yet God was only responding to his need. Twice the Lord fed him with bread and water which kept him strong for forty days. My first point for today, God knows your need better than you do. At times under pressure, all you need is getting away from everything, seating down and letting the Lord feed you with bread and water because the journey is still long. Giving up is not an option, He has not given up on you. To continue Blessings Ev, God’s servant

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Kings 6:17, “And Elisha prayed, and said, “LORD, I pray, open his eyes that he may see.” Then the LORD opened the eyes of the young man, and he saw”

There is a great difference between SEEING WHAT YOU BELIEVE and BELIEVING WHAT YOU SEE. I prefer the first one as it teaches you to see things through the eyes of faith. Faith negates the facts; it sees beyond the natural and presents a whole new picture of things which produces hope. People can see something the way it is, you are seeing what it can be. That is seeing what you believe. You can be in a situation that everyone has stopped hoping for good out of it like the case of the woman with the issue of blood but when you see far beyond the natural that you can be healed, you can encourage yourself into the victory, trusting in the one who is able. By what people had seen, she had been in her condition for 12 years, by what she was seeing, there was still hope. It’s our perception of things that channels us to see things from either men’s point of view or God’s. If you wait for people to always see it the way you do to agree with you before you move, you will never move. The woman with the issue of blood moved alone because of what she saw. Proverbs 23:7, “For as he thinks (sees) in his heart, so is he”

In my text, the servant of the man of God Elisha freaked out when he saw the soldiers surrounding their camp, the man of God was peaceful because he saw what he believed. Is it possible for the Lord to take away temporarily what He has given you because that thing took away your complete faith in Him? Or He could take away something that He knows you can’t do without and then He becomes your eyes to prove to you that He is in control of every part of your being? Paul (Saul) was persecuting Christians but after encountering with the Lord on the road to Damascus, Acts 9:8, Then Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened he saw no one. But they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus. 9, And he was three days without sight“. His ability to see in the natural was taken away and had to be led for a season. His spiritual eyes were activated at that point and he was never the same again. At times what we see with our natural eyes can contaminate what we should see with our spiritual eyes. For Saul, he was beginning a great journey that needed assurance that it wasn’t by might nor by power but by the Spirit of the Lord says the Lord of host. He needed more of His spiritual eyes than His physical eyes. One man said when he had his two natural eyes and was living in sin, he was blind but when he came to Christ after loosing one of his physical eyes through an accident, he could clearly see things more than he did with his two eyes. Are not the eyes also the window to the soul? Are not eyes associated with visions? It’s also through the same eyes that we can be deceived.

My question to you this morning, what do you see? have you reached to that place where you prayed that God would take your ability to see naturally in other words see things men’s way and desire to receive the Spiritual eyes that sees far and beyond. I believe you have to loose something before you can gain something. I desire to see more of what He sees rather than what I see. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Kings 6:17, “And Elisha prayed, and said, “LORD, I pray, open his eyes that he may see.” Then the LORD opened the eyes of the young man, and he saw”

Have you ever been frustrated because someone or some people did not see what you saw? Had a vision, shared it but the impression you received from people gave you an indication that they did not see it, catch it or maybe were not willing to see it? You sit and wonder why they can’t see it; you are frustrated as to why they cannot catch it. I’ve been there, been frustrated until I learnt something new.

If you remember the story of Elisha and the Syrians, Elisha knew the plot they had against the Israelites and he sent a message to warn the king of Israel about it. The Syrians were not too happy with Elisha so they planned to capture him. They came in at night with such a great army and surrounded the city where Elisha was. In the morning his servant wakes up, goes out and sees that they are surrounded and panic strikes in. Before I go further, the scripture tells us that Elisha knew everything they were saying in the inner chambers, closed door meetings. It had to be through a God given vision. If the army came at night, I’m sure he already knew because he saw them and he still slept through the night peacefully. I want us to understand that there are certain things that are not of the ordinary. You can make a decision that goes past the normal ordinary circumstances and many may begin to freak out as they do not understand why you can make such a move when they do not see something in the natural that can help it to its destination. Many want to be sure before they can adapt or accept a change. You can even be talked into changing your mind. The servant is not at peace because all he can see in the natural is a tough situation. A situation like this had never presented itself. What will you do with people who are not seeing what you see? Elisha wasn’t even frustrated with his servant for freaking out, he knew his servant had not seen what he saw. I believe that when God gives you a vision, yes there may be panic all around but you with the vision will be at peace about it. You are not seeing in the natural, you are seeing in the spiritual realm.

vs. 15; “…Alas; my master! What shall we do?”  16, “So he answered; “Do not fear; for those who are with us are more than those who are with them”. We can encourage people not to be afraid of the new move still few will embrace it. Elisha was seeing that there were more with them than those surrounding them. There is less in the natural (just them two) and there are more with them in the spiritual realm. The natural eyes perceive of now situation, the spiritual eyes perceives of something greater. Instead of Elisha rebuking, condemning, or being frustrated with his servant, here is what he did 2 Kings 6:17, “And Elisha prayed, and said, “LORD, I pray, open his eyes that he may see.” Then the LORD opened the eyes of the young man, and he saw”. This is the best thing you can do for those who are not seeing the vision or for those you want to catch the vision you have. Not praying about them but praying for them for God to open their eyes to see what you see, to experience what you experience. Don’t condemn or discourage someone about what they are doing till you first find out and understand why they do things the way they do. I have been rebuked by some people about the way I present the gospel and I normally say, “before you rebuke me, find out why I share my faith the way I do” and many times they come back to agree with me about how I share my faith because they now see what I see. Got to stop, will continue. Blessings Evans

title.rendered: The Power Of A Map, by Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“These all died in faith, not having received the promise, but having seen them a far off, and were persuaded of them and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on earth. For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country. And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned. But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly: wherefore God is not a shamed to be called their God: for he has prepared for them a city” Hebrews 11:13-16

This passage of Scripture refers to the O.T saints who died with the faith that God had something better for them in store. What concerned them most was not when the promises were to be fulfilled but what they had to do in order to receive the promise. They were concerned also about the correct paths or ways they were to take to lead them to the promises in the now and then life. In their lifetime, they did not see the final promised blessing of the redeemed. Their primary hope was for was eternal life with God in a heavenly homeland (Where there is true homeland eternal security). They fixed their eyes on the new citizenship in the new heaven and new earth. See Isaiah 65:17 and Phil. 3: 20 and Revelation 21:1

The believers of today must likewise perceive correctly in faith their life’s destination and persevere in faith and trust in God, even when they do not see all the promises of God fulfilled in their lives. Believers must be ready and allow God to test their faith. For faith that cannot be tested cannot be trusted. On the long life’s journey to the destinations God has determined for us, one thing is critical, if we are to reach the destinations: and that is having correct map. A map is simply what shows the right way of getting to a destination from the point where one is. A map is about a territory. It is not the territory. It shows points and locations in the territory. Christians are citizens of two territories: the earth, where we live right now and the heavenly kingdom where we are headed. On earth, we are called pilgrims or strangers or sojourners. In other words, we don’t belong here permanently. Our permanent citizenship is heaven. But while we are here, on a journey, we have dreams, goals, wishes, hopes and desires which we would like to achieve, acquire or reach. And, it is in God’s best interest that we successfully reach the destinations. These things are in the territory of life. Do you know where they are? Do you know how to get there? Can you be able to tell when you arrive or whether you should still be on the road? These are important questions to ask on your way to your destiny. Faith is wonderful and you cannot do without it. But accurate roadmap is crucial. The Word of God is your accurate roadmap. It must be studied, correctly interpreted, understood and correctly applied. God has given the directions to all you could ever need or desire, in The Word. Use it. Don’t’ depend on your own knowledge or experience or assumptions, for direction. Worse still, do not depend on others who don’t have the correct map, don’t know the way and yet are always trying to give directions. Faith, correct perception of where you are headed and perseverance will lead you to receiving the promise. “Seek you first the Kingdom of God and all these other things shall be added unto you” Be independent most of the time; dependant on others sometimes; but, depend on God all the time for direction, strength to persevere and faith to receive the promise. Avoid any misguiding direction or information. Then, like the O.T saints, you will embrace the promises even if you don’t receive them.

“It is the way we “see” the world-not in terms of our visual sense of sight, but in terms of perceiving, understanding, interpreting, in light of God’s Word (which is what faith is) that determines how we choose paths that lead us to our desired destination”  Blessings Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 16:28, “Then Samson called to the LORD; saying; “O Lord GOD; remember me; I pray! Strengthen me; I pray; just this once; O God; that I may with one blow take vengeance on the Philistines for my two eyes!”

Rambo movies series acted by Sylvester Stallone who played John Rambo, gives a little idea of what Samson might have been like. A few questions to ask ourselves as we finish these series. We see in the story, Samson is finally deceived, he reveals where his strength lies; his hair which was a symbol of strength and the presence of God. As the children of God, the enemy is always after our strength. If he can find it, he will try and steal, kill or destroy it. That is why the bible says in 1Peter 5:8, “Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour“. If the Son of God was tempted in the wilderness to reveal his strength, for sure we will be tempted to find where our strength lies. Jesus won because He was sober and vigilant on the other hand Samson slept and the enemy cut his hair (lost the presence of God). I would rather loose everything but not the presence of God. The enemy only wins when men are a sleep.

Vs. 20, “And she said, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” So he awoke from his sleep, and said, “I will go out as before, at other times, and shake myself free!” But he did not know that the LORD had departed from him“. You toy with sin, God may still let you retain the anointing for a season and if there is no room for repentance, don’t be surprised if He lifts His anointing (presence) off you. David’s prayer in repentance after he sinned was Psalm 51:8, “Do not cast me away from Your presence, And do not take Your Holy Spirit from me“. Not even once did I hear Samson confess to have messed up, asking God for forgiveness and praying that His presence would not leave him. When the presence of God had departed, he was left vulnerable with no strength to fight back. All he ever did cost him his eyes and because God was not in control of his life at this moment, he became a slave to the Philistines with no eyes because they plucked them out.

Judges 16:28, “Then Samson called to the LORD; saying; “O Lord GOD; remember me; I pray! Strengthen me; I pray; just this once; O God; that I may with one blow take vengeance on the Philistines for my two eyes!”. Can we say he had a lot of chances to get things straight? Was God done with him? Did God schedule for him to die this soon and die in the hands of the enemy? He was born for a reason and even in the midst of his foolish moves, God still accomplished his plan. Can we say that God was more concerned about what to do to the enemy than He cared about Samson as a person? I believe God will do His part and let you do yours. So Samson had one last chance to get things right with God and instead, he is seeing an opportunity for revenge for his eyes (self) and he sincerely prays one last prayer. At times if we insist on having our way, be sure God may let you have your way. It may not be His will, but your will. The Israelites cried to God for a king. God took time to show them how an earthly king would treat them but they refused to listen. God wanted to be their king but because they persisted, he turned them loose and gave them what they wanted and you know the rest of the story. And God gave Samson his last request, the bible says that he destroyed more enemies in his death than he did in his life, Jesus also destroyed more enemies in His death than He did in His life. Started well, finished poorly, his weaknesses out of control brought him down. Don’t let what God is doing in your life cloud your vision, let His hands be upon everything He is doing, Let Him sit on those weakness that want to be out of control, ask Him not to cast you from his presence, let what He has invested in you not be about you but about His business that you may finish the race with joy. Just like Samson, you too are born for a reason, the question is, “will you start and finish strong?”. Blessings Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 16:28, “Then Samson called to the LORD; saying; “O Lord GOD; remember me; I pray! Strengthen me; I pray; just this once; O God; that I may with one blow take vengeance on the Philistines for my two eyes!”

It’s nearly impossible to live in this world without being offended and offending. Jesus said in Luke 17:1,”….It is impossible that no offenses should come“, look at the word impossible, not hard but impossible. There is a tendency of feeling the urge to get even with a person who has offended you. “It’s not right what they have done to me, I will give them a dose of their own medicine”. “I cannot feel this way because of what you have done when you are having a good time”. In revenge, you don’t want to be around them, talk to them, you lie about them, cut them with words etc Romans 12:19, “Do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God’s wrath, for it is written: “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,” says the Lord (NIV) .In Samson’s case he was offended and he sought revenge. Revenge in simple words is action taken in return for an injury or offense. It’s also to inflict punishment in return. If a person does a good thing to you, can you do the same and call it revenge? No because revenge is a punishment.

Judges 15:7, “Samson said to them, “Since you would do a thing like this, I will surely take revenge on you, and after that I will cease” Samson had left his wife in Philistine when he went back to his home. I don’t know why he did not take his wife with him, may be because she would not be welcomed in his home. He comes back to check on his wife and finds that his wife was given to his companion. He gets angry, seeks revenge by going to the field, and catches 300 foxes. He ties their tails two by two, set their tales on fire and let’s them run in the Philistines field burning it down. Was his anger justified? Did his anger need to be directed to other people who were not involved with this issue?. Watch this, instead of dealing with his in-laws, he directed his revenge to the Philistines and the philistines directed their revenge to his in laws and he revenges by slaughtering men. Revenge does more harm than good. How many times did David have opportunities to revenge on Saul and yet he did not? I see a lot of “I and “ME” which is about self in Samson’s story. We are not anointed for self, in fact the anointing in our lives is not even about us or for us, what’s in your vessel is for those whom God wanted that anointing to reach. Jesus said, Luke 4:18, “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because God has anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor…, “, Acts 10:38, “how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him“. Jesus had more enemies than anyone yet he did good unto them. Even those who crucified Him, He had the power to revenge by calling fire from heaven to consume them. His prayer was, “Father forgive them for they know not what they are doing“. Everything that He did was not about self, He was doing them to please the Father. Samson on the other hand, everything that he did, all came back to self. Your position is not about you but about Him (God). Joseph rose to power and he knew God had raised him for a reason, he used his position to serve others. So was Esther, Solomon, David, Stephen, Paul and the rest who took what God had placed in their lives to serve others and God blessed them. They had people on their cases but they let God fight for them. Stand firm, do all you can for the Lord with what He has given you, ask the Lord to deal with those you would want to take revenge on. I believe God would have dealt with the Philistines in his own way, I don’t think how Samson went about it is the way He had planned though it still accomplished His purpose. Blessings Ev
